item.title: Game Freak Trademark Could Hint at New Pokemon Release
item.description:
A new Game Freak trademark may indicate that a new Pokemon TCG release is on the way. This Pokemon TCG release may be an expansion based around Rayquaza, which has fans of the Gen 3 Pokemon excited.

While not every trademark filed necessarily gets utilized, prior trademark filings from Game Freak have sometimes revealed upcoming sets for the tabletop game. For example, in September 2024, trademarks were discovered for Black Bolt and White Flare, which ended up becoming a new expansion of cards, which released in Japan in June of 2025, with an English-language release following afterward.

Now, a new trademark leak indicates that a Rayquaza-themed expansion could be on its way to players. As spotted by PokeBeach, the new trademark is for "Storm Emerald," and was filed by Game Freak. Very little is known about the plans for this title outside of its name, but there's already been a great deal of speculation based upon prior trademarks made for the Pokemon franchise. The trademark was filed under some of the same classifications as prior Pokemon TCG trademarks, further cementing the likelihood of it being utilized for a future expansion. Rayquaza is believed to be the theme due to the name, especially with Rayquaza having been the featured Pokemon in Pokemon Emerald .

When Could Storm Emerald Release for Pokemon TCG?

At this time, there's no official release date or confirmation of the set directly from official Pokemon channels. However, one can speculate based upon how trademarks for the franchise have been handled in the past. Several similar Pokemon TCG trademarks have previously been filed about six months prior to their names being used to launch new sets. If that's the case, players may be able to expect Storm Emerald to launch sometime at the end of 2025, likely November or December. However, that is the expected release window for the Japanese version of the set. English-language equivalent Pokemon TCG releases tend to launch some time after that, so players may not want to hold their breath for this expansion just yet.

Pokemon TCG releases are looking stacked for the remainder of the year, so players have plenty else to look forward to. The English version of Black Bolt and White Flare will reportedly be arriving starting in July. Meanwhile, Japan will be seeing several new launches, including Inferno X, as well as Pokemon TCG Mega Brave and Mega Symphonia sets, which will mark the end of an era for Pokemon TCG .

item.title: Pokemon Fan Designs Regional Variants for Nosepass and Probopass
item.description:
A talented Pokemon fan has recently designed regional forms for Nosepass and Probopass. Regional forms were introduced in the seventh generation of Pokemon games, with the first alternative critters being Alolan variants, and they have been fairly popular with fan artists since then.

Nosepass is a Rock-type Pokemon originally introduced in Gen 3. In this generation, it was possible to find this rare monster only in the Granite Cave. Initially, the critter did not have any official evolution, but from Gen 4 onward, it was possible to evolve Nosepass into Probopass by using a Thunder Stone on it or leveling it up in a special magnetic field, which can be found in multiple games of the series. Unlike its pre-evolution, Probopass is a dual-type Rock/Steel Pokemon, and it has access to powerful moves such as Stone Edge, Zap Cannon, and Earth Power.

Now, a Pokemon fan artist called FallinDevast has devised creative new regional evolutions for Nosepass and Probopass. Nosepass became Nopass, looking like a gray stone wall with a huge yellow nose and closed eyes. Probopass, on the other hand, became Problypass, which looked like a castle’s gate, complete with a tower for a helmet, teeth for the gate, and the same yellow nose. While FallinDevast did not say much about these new variants, others chimed in and suggested that these forms were perfect as Galarian variants or could work well with any European-based region due to their shape. Overall, FallinDevast’s art was greatly praised by the Pokemon community, as the fan artist gained over 10,000 upvotes.

Pokemon Fan's Nosepass and Probopass Regional Forms

It’s not very common to see alternative takes on Nosepass and Probopass, but when these artworks are shared with the community, they’re generally very interesting. For example, last year, a fan created a female version of Probopass, which looked like a steel kettle with a big red nose, hair, earrings, and a hat.

Other interesting artworks shared with the community were Viking-inspired variants of Nosepass and Probopass, created by a fan in 2023. In these forms, the critter would look like a stalagmite in its first evolution, and the head of a Viking warrior in the second one.

Yet another fan created a human form for Nosepass, which depicted the monster as a woman in a wheelchair, looking fairly original. It’s always nice to see Pokemon fans getting creative, so hopefully, others will continue to share their work with the community and come up with even more new forms for Nosepass and Probopass.

item.title: Dune: Awakening Smashes Funcom Record
item.description:
Dune: Awakening has amassed a total of one million players since launch, becoming the fastest-selling title developed by Funcom. Giving the highly popular sci-fi franchise, Dune , a survival game spin, Dune: Awakening rolled out to a positive reception on PC on June 10.

Nearly three years after its reveal at Gamescom 2022, Dune: Awakening arrived on Steam earlier this month and got off to a remarkably strong start. On the launch day, it crossed 140K concurrent players and, within six days, reached its current peak of over 189K concurrent players on the platform. Such strong popularity coincided with notable praise from critics, leading to a score of 81 on OpenCritic. As expected, Dune: Awakening 's impressive launch performance resulted in a commercially fruitful period for Funcom, during which the American developer not only broke a personal record but also saw the game race to a big sales milestone.

Dune: Awakening announced that it reached one million players on Steam, which translates into a staggering one million units sold in around two weeks of launch. In the process, the open-world title made history for Funcom and became its fastest-selling title ever. The developer stressed Dune: Awakening 's commercial numbers by sharing that its previous game, Conan Exiles , took one year to sell the same number of copies. Apart from this achievement, Funcom also showed an infographic shedding light on the player activity that has taken place in the sci-fi game thus far. It was revealed that over 66K players had perished in sandstorms, over 120K building pieces had been used, and more than half a million Ornithopters had been crafted, among other things. Moreover, BeneGesserit was revealed to be the favorite starting mentor of Dune: Awakening players, whereas Mentat turned out to be the least-picked mentor.

Dune: Awakening Races Past One Million Sales

Funcom has registered a big win, with Dune: Awakening reaching a million players despite only being available on Steam right now. With hopes of keeping the momentum going, the devs now appear to be focused on delivering updates that address player concerns surrounding the new Dune game. In a recent Q&A session on Reddit, the studio shared that a new update containing "a lot of" quality-of-life improvements was being considered for an early July release.

While Dune: Awakening is finally out on PC, there is still an air of mystery around when exactly console players might get to play the game. In any case, according to a recent statement, Dune fans on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S shouldn't expect to get their hands on the MMO title until 2026.

Rise from survival to dominance on the most dangerous planet in the universe. Dune: Awakening combines the grit and creativity of sandbox survival games with the social interactivity of a large, persistent multiplayer game to create a unique and ambitious Open World Survival MMO.

Awaken The Sleeper

Your journey begins on Arrakis, with its vast deserts and colossal sandworms. Meet characters from the movies and books as you follow your story across Dune. Discover new allies and enemies and exploit your relationships to uncover the mystery that lies just beneath the surface of the sands.

Choose Your Identity

Craft your identity and build your prowess, from deep character creation to skills and abilities taught by specialists like Mentats and Bene Gesserit. Declare your loyalties by what you wear and become known by what you do, whether you are a specialized master or multi-talented adept.

Explore Arrakis Like Never Before

Dune: Awakening brings the epic landscapes of Arrakis to vivid life. Explore boundless rolling dunes, ancient underground Ecology Labs, and deep canyons pockmarked with caves, where bandits seek easy prey. Wander the bustling villages before braving the lawless and ever-changing deep desert.

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2’s Renewed Hype Deserves to Be More Than a Flash in a Pan
item.description:
It’s been a couple of good years for the Star Wars video game franchise, with fans getting treated to great games like the Star Wars Jedi series and the latest Fortnite collaboration. However, the game that many fans seem to be booting up recently has been Star Wars Battlefront 2 . According to Steam statistics, this 2017 title has seen a significant spike in players, which is a hot topic for discussion in r/StarWarsBattlefront and other gaming subreddits. There could be a few reasons as to why Star Wars Battlefront 2 , an almost eight-year-old game, is seeing a resurgence, which should be a sign of better things for the series.

Star Wars Battlefront 2 received lukewarm reviews because of its unsatisfying single-player campaign and its initially egregious microtransactions related to upgrades for multiplayer. The game tweaked this system, making it more fair for lower spenders. However, Battlefront 2 saw another setback in the swarm of cheaters, making almost every match on PC a frustrating battle. Therefore, it’s a surprise that the game continues to survive and is seeing its player count rise significantly in 2025.

Why Star Wars Battlefront 2’s Sudden Spike in Popularity Should Lead to a Sequel

Battlefront 2 has a Huge Discount on Steam

An effective way to renew players’ interest in an old game like Star Wars Battlefront 2 is to provide a discount. The game started to slash its price around May, with players being able to get the game for US$7.99 from its original price of US$39.99. This coincides with the sudden spike in Battlefront 2 's player count starting from that month. Its price dipped lower to just $3.99 around June 19, with the Special Promotion lasting until June 27th. The 90% discount during this month could also correspond to the game reaching its five-year peak player count.

Andor and Fortnite Could be Drumming up Hype for Battlefront 3

Muhannad Ben Amor, who plays Wilmon Paak in the critically acclaimed Star Wars show Andor , recently posted on his Instagram story that he has logged over 469 hours of Battlefront 2 on his PlayStation 5. He also stated that he’s been playing the game since release and that “ Star Wars gotta give us Battlefront 3 ASAP.”

Apart from Amor’s rallying cry for a sequel, Fortnite could also be a factor in renewing interest in the Battlefront series. The recent and limited Galactic Battle Battle Royale event let players use iconic weapons like Captain Phasma’s F-11D Blaster, wield the power of a lightsaber and the Force by training with hologram Rey, and even ride an X-Wing or TIE fighter. Now that the event is over, the best game to provide a similar experience is Star Wars Battlefront 2 .

The Rise in Battlefront 2’s Popularity is Proof of Interest for a Sequel

DICE has already ended support for Star Wars Battlefront 2 , which means that fans shouldn’t expect any content updates from it. It could also be a sign that the studio isn’t interested in creating a sequel. However, the game is seeing a resurgence since more people have gotten to try it out during the past few months of Battlefront 2 's Special Promotion on Steam.

Its player count is steadily hovering around the high 20,000s at the time of writing, so players are clearly enjoying it and riding its hype train. Meanwhile, developers and actors who worked on Battlefront 2 have also voiced support and encouragement in this hype amounting to something more. The ball is seemingly now in EA and DICE’s court, and it'll be interesting to see how long Battlefront 2 's renewed hype can be sustained.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Detailed List of Upcoming Nod-Krai Characters
item.description:
A reliable source has shared a detailed overview of Genshin Impact characters coming out in Nod-Krai, revealing their gender, element, and faction. With Natlan coming to an end with Version 5.8, Genshin Impact fans have turned their full attention to Nod-Krai. From a lore standpoint, the upcoming region will attempt to tie together any lingering plot threads and slowly set the stage for the Traveler's confrontation with the Tsaritsa. From a gameplay standpoint, Nod-Krai will introduce Lunar Reactions, a way to hopefully improve upon underwhelming Elemental Reactions such as Superconduct and Crystallize.

Ineffa in Genshin Impact is intended to be the first piece of this puzzle – a mechanical construct built by the founder of the Clink-Crank Krumkake Craftshop. As a 5-Star Electro character, she will introduce Lunar-Charged, removing the weaknesses of the original Electro-Charged, and putting an interesting spin on it. While she will already improve on existing hypercarries like Cyno, her best teammate may come in September 2025.

According to Shiroha, whose Honkai: Star Rail record has been spotless, enough information is known about Nod-Krai to put together a comprehensive list of its playable characters. While it unfortunately claims that Dottore won't become playable during Nod-Krai in Genshin Impact , the upcoming region will feature other heavy hitters such as Durin, Columbina, Varka, Nicole, and even Alice herself. The Lantern Rite character will be the White Horse Adeptus from Moonlight Bamboo Forest, who also happens to be a Shade of Istaroth like Venti.

It's imperative to keep one thing in mind: the information presented by leaks is always subject to change. Even if HoYoverse may indeed have a roadmap similar to the one assembled by Shiroha, there is no guarantee that it will stay the same a year from now. As such, it may be best for Genshin Impact players to set their expectations accordingly. After all, at one point, Charlotte was an Anemo character from Mondstadt, Kirara was a Geo Bow unit, and Dahlia in Genshin Impact was fully designed by 2023.

The chart reveals that Version 6.0 will introduce a 5-Star Electro Male and a 5-Star Geo Female, which should give fans enough information to formulate a pulling strategy. Whereas the male character will be a hypercarry for Lunar-Charged, the female character will seemingly do the same for Lunar-Crystallize. With Primogems in Genshin Impact being scarce in the last two updates, players will need to make some important decisions heading into Version 5.8. Nod-Krai is set to open its doors to the Traveler on September 10, 2025.
